details.title: Synthetic Aperture Imaging Radar and Moving Targets
details.abstract: This paper considers the effects of slowly moving targets as they appear in the output of an airborne coherent side-looking synthetic aperture imaging radar. The image of a moving reflector is described, and two approaches to airborne moving target indication (AMTI) are summarized. It is shown that the effects of target movement are decreased as the radar scan rate is increased, and are increased as the (Doppler processed) compression ratio is increased.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
